direction.raw_text: a/k/a LETAC. The facility is a converted aerospace research building in Pacoima. Funded by government black book dollars. The look is a mixture of industrial grime and high-tech sparkle. Banks upon banks of computer equipment. Wires, cables, conduits, connectors everywhere you look. In complete disarray to the uninitiated. But to those in the know, this is the most advanced facility of its kind in the world. The building is partitioned into dozens of stations. At each station, a leading engineer in his field is frantically readying a prototype for demonstration. Each new technology designed to help fight the new Cold War... the War on Crime. The atmosphere is competitive. Voices are loud. Tension, anticipation in the air. Only a lucky few will have their inventions approved for production.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INSIDE THE LAW ENFORCEMENT TECHNOLOGY ADVANCEMENT CENTER

direction.raw_text: . At a station in the middle of the room, TWO UNCONSCIOUS BODIES lie on narrow beds wearing form-fitting skull caps made of polyurethane. Each skull cap has 100 acupuncture needles stuck through it at points designated as neural primes. Each needle is directly connected to the participant's nervous system. The tail end of each needle is connected to a fiber optic wire which leads to one of numerous interconnected computers surrounding the beds. Each of these components isn't much to look at on its own. But together, with the rest of the apparatus, are part of something very new  a revolutionary law enforcement training device whose name you read:

Red is thrown backwards into the stall. Blood splatters from his mouth, adding another shade of redness to his face. Red's teeth stick out of Parker's fist. Parker pulls out the teeth. You see what look like two viruses, which represent each criminal's psychological profile, attacking each other. The result is a molten blob. Berkowitz was added to create Sid 1.3. A three-way psychological battle, more hostile than the first, occurs. Sid 1.4, adding the terrorist, Abu Nidal, makes the conflict even more violent. And so on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison stares at the computer screen in awe. Parker flips through CD-ROM hard copies of the different versions of Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lindenmeyer put increasingly complex combinations of criminal psychological profiles together to develop the ultimate villain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Creating a whole far more dangerous than the sum of its parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But rather than selecting pieces from each individual, he simply let the stronger traits of each individual cannibalize the weaker ones. She continues opening the files of the higher versions of Sid. Version 5.9 consists of 67 different profiles. The visualized psychological battle is intense. And extremely violent. The 6.7 version, with 183 profiles, is even worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a good bet a couple of the dominant personalities teamed up to overpower the others. (a beat) The question is, which one of the dominants then finally managed to take control? Attempting to open the files of the composite profiles, Madison discovers they are protected by encryption.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll let us see the ingredients that went in, but not how the soup turned out after stirring. Madison scrolls through the list of 183 names, stopping at the name MATHEW GRIMES. Alarm registers on her face. As Parker comes over to look over her shoulder, she quickly scrolls through the list to get the name off the screen. He holds the Sid 6.7 CD-ROM in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is getting you pumped up, isn't it? This is like the World Series to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a matter of fact, it is. Parker points to a name on the screen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember the bowling ball bag Sid carried with him in virtual reality?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dahmer carried the head of one of his victims in a bowling bag for over a week. Kept it in his locker while he was at work in a candy factory. (re: Sid 6.7 CD-ROM) We need to get a look at Sid 6.7's final profile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we need to do is stop playing with computers and go catch the sonof-a-bitch before he kills anybody else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In order to find him, we have to understand what makes him tick...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .7 CD-ROM being inserted into a disc drive inside the Cal Tech Computer Lab. Very high-tech. Sitting at the computer is ALEXIEV BORGEN, 60s, the "grand old wizard" of the facility. Parker and Madison sit next to him. Around them, young Lindenmeyers are everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daryl Lindenmeyer was only here briefly, one semester at most. But he was singularly the most brilliant student I ever had in a classroom. He created programs so beautiful, so lyrical, they were almost like symphonies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you tell us what's on the disc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is one program with approximately 1.3 million lines of programming. It is thoroughly secured, which is not surprising considering Lindenmeyer created it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think you can get into the program?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to say  Lindenmeyer's protection mechanisms were always diabolically clever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should see what he's been up to recently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kissing passionately inside a car parked along a deserted street in Hollywood. Music blares from inside the vehicle. Steam on the windows partially obscures your view. As well as Sid 6.7's. He stares menacingly through the side window. Enjoying the show. His eye momentarily wanders. The young lovers are completely oblivious. Sid 6.7 caresses the gun taken from the cops in Toluca Lake as if it stimulated him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Dahmer part of me wants to boil you for dinner. The Manson part wants to recruit you to become part of my family. (a beat) You know what the Berkowitz part of me wants to do? He raises the gun, placing it against the steamed window. But does NOT pull the trigger. His face going through a rapid change of expression  as if a battle for control of his emotions were going on. Regaining control, Sid 6.7 lowers the gun. He stands back. Reflecting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Craft can only become art when the creator sets his sights on something never yet achieved... (a beat) Like an apprentice about to become a master, the imitator is about to become an originator. He pockets his weapon and walks
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bartender is a low-tech ROBO-TENDER. PATRONS sit quietly, drinking themselves into oblivion. Sid 6.7 takes a seat next to an BUSINESSMAN slumped at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever have one of those days where you decide something important about yourself? You know, where you say, "I'm not just what I've been programmed to be. I can do what I want, when I want, how I want, because I'm my own person?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You one of them New Age assholes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a soul on a personal journey. What I've realized is that I'm capable of anything. I have to start expanding my horizons... The Robo-Tender rolls over to Sid 6.7.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want...a...drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To think you constitute one of my ancestors He shoots the RoboTender between his mechanical eyes. The businessman smiles, like he's thought about doing exactly the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, buddy...thinking big is fine.. .but you shouldn't forget where you come from, either. Sid 6.7 thinks about it. Long and hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you're absolutely right. (pointing) Would you mind sitting over there? He points to a table with several other BUSINESSMEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every orchestra is divided into sections. Like instruments sit with like instruments. Now be a good instrument and sit with your kind... He lifts the businessman off his bar stool and carries him to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on which a RED DOT moves west along a street in Los Feliz. The map occupies a wall inside Chief Cox's Office in the L.A.P. D. Downtown Headquarters. Cox, Wallace and Deane look on.

direction.raw_text: What are they doing in Los Feliz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison lives two blocks from their present location.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would they be going there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish we could hear them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My engineers say the audio tap should be ready to field test in six months. Off Cox's look, we

result.heading: AN ELECTRONIC MAP OF LOS ANGELES

direction.raw_text: Parker drives through a residential neighborhood. 9 PM. Madison points to a house on the right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not this one, but the next one. The one with the bicycle out front... Parker stops in front of a modest, but wellkept, house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll wait out here. Madison pockets the car keys, then reveals a pair of handcuffs. She latches one cuff to the steering wheel, and holds up the other toward Parker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me your wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a goddam break. I'm not going to go anywhere alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm going to make sure of it. (not wavering) Give me your wrist. Parker relents, and holds up his wrist. Madison places the cuff around it, then gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison walks up the steps to the front porch. She is immediately intercepted by her daughter, KARIN, 7, who bursts out of the front door and leaps into her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mommy's home! Mommy's home! Karin's BABY-SITTER opens the door for Madison as she carries her daughter inside. Parker stares from squad car in surprise. Even disbelief. He had no idea Madison was a mother. Moments later, Karin comes back out and sits on the front steps. Staring at Parker. With fascination. Curiosity. Wondering who this strange man is, and why he's sitting in a police car outside her house. But not saying a word. Parker stares back as if carrying on a silent conversation with her. A multitude of expressions passing over his face as memories of his own daughter flash through his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison sits at a desk, typing quickly at a computer. Via modem, she connects with the L. A. P. D. Criminal Library. She rifles through data concerning MATHEW GRIMES, who was the leader of a cult of cyber anarchists. He was known as the Charles Manson of technological terrorism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From both newspaper ARTICLES and news FOOTAGE, the following information about him becomes clear: Grimes was an expert at media manipulation. He delighted in publicly humiliating anyone who stood in his way. The Mayor of Los Angeles, Bob Bennett, who offered increasingly higher rewards for Grimes' capture, was Grimes' primary nemesis. L.A.P.D. Special Investigations Division Officer Parker Barnes managed to stop Grimes from killing Mayor Bennett. Grimes retaliated by repeatedly humiliating Parker with false leads and lawsuits. You see footage of a woman lying dead in an alley. A note is pinned to her clothing. The note reads: "HEY, PARKER, THIS ONE'S FOR YOU." Grimes then kidnapped Parker's wife and daughter. Parker located the group in a club, but only in time to witness their deaths. Parker then killed everybody in the club, including the six cult members and two completely innocent people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison stares gravely into the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grimes, you better not be the dominant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parker and Karin continue staring at each other in silence. He smiles. Then she smiles. She wiggles her nose. Then so does he. Madison comes out wearing fresh clothing, then kisses her daughter good night. As Madison goes to the squad car, Karin waves good-bye to Parker. He does the same. Karin's babysitter then leads her back inside the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison gets in, immediately noticing the handcuffs dangling from the steering wheel. Parker has been free the entire time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Told you I wasn't going to go anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you get your hand out? As she unlocks the handcuffs from the steering wheel, Parker wiggles his mechanical hand in front of her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes, I like being part machine. Annoyed, Madison tosses him the car keys. He starts the engine and drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me you had a daughter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I prefer keeping my professional life separate from my personal life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's beautiful, you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank-you. (a beat) Her name is Karin. She turns on the police radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to tell me the real reason we stopped at your house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, it was on the way and I wanted to change clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should practice lying more often. You're awful at it. (a beat) Where to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid 6.7 is no longer bound by his programming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that he's in the real world, there are no longer limitations on his behavior like there were in virtual reality. Sid is going to evolve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds to me like a welleducated way of saying you have no idea what to do next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I do know is that whatever he's becoming, Sid 6.7 is going to be even worse than he was before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then all we can do is stay mobile and alert. He's got to make a move sometime, and we've got to be ready when he does. (a beat) Welcome to police work. You better like coffee. He turns up the police radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid 6.7 has separated the patrons into four separate groups: older men and woman, and younger men and woman. All are frozen in their seats with fear. Sid 6.7 points his gun at one group, then another, waving his arm as if he were a conductor, and as if his gun were a baton. Sid 6.7 clearly enjoys this game of terror. He delights in the patrons' fear, and revels in his power over them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good... Very good... Nice... (pointing at a woman) You -- in the middle -- don't hold back. Give it to me! He fires his gun just above her head. She SCREAMS in terror. SID 6.7 (CONT'D) That's better... He continues aiming his gun from face to face, seeking ever increasing emotional responses from his "instruments." A guy entering the bar does a quick about face. Gone by the time Sid 6.7 glances at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I hate interruptions. (to the patrons) Once again, from the top BOOM! He shoots again, just missing a man's foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: buying two coffees from a downtown street vendor. She returns to the squad car, which is barely moving. Traffic is at a near standstill because of an accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parker drinks his coffee black. Madison adds two creams, two sugars. The cackling from the police radio continues unabated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgot what real coffee tastes like...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, considering you've only been out of prison for seven hours, you're readapting quite well. (a beat) Wait, I didn't mean that the way it sounded. I meant...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it, all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit, I hate sounding so clinical all the time. All I meant to say was I thought you were doing well, but then I...

direction.raw_text: Relax. I know what you meant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ruin so many moments by analyzing them when I should just be living them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why don't you start practicing and keep your mouth shut for a while? Madison stops herself from speaking. It isn't easy for her. Parker cracks a faint smile. YOU HEAR the police radio.

direction.raw_text: ...report of a possible hostage situation inside a bar on the corner of Figueroa and Sixth. Description of the perp matches the surveillance photographs from LETAC taken this morning...

direction.raw_text: That's only a couple blocks from here.

direction.raw_text: I'll meet you there. Tossing his coffee out the window, he opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop me. He gets out, running down the sidewalk. He flies past the cars inching down the block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parker! PARKER! (a beat) Shit! She climbs into the driver's seat, spilling hot coffee on herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parker bolts recklessly through the downtown street. A hunter hot on the trail of his prey in an urban jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid 6.7 gently caresses the hair of a terrified young WOMAN sitting among several others. You hear the sound of tires
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to a halt outside. Sid 6.7 remains unconcerned. He toys with the Woman, pointing the gun in her face, then pulling it back. Her expression changes instantly. Dramatically.

direction.raw_text: I just love how responsive you are.

direction.raw_text: Freeze!

direction.raw_text: Put the gun down, nice and... Sid 6.7 spins around and fires twice before he can finish his sentence. Both Cops receive IDENTICAL wounds in their shooting arms, reminding you of the wounds Parker and John first received in the opening virtual reality sequence. Sid 6.7 takes a bow, as if on stage.

direction.raw_text: Thank you, ladies and gentlemen, you've been a real pleasure... As he walks toward the exit, he admires himself in the mirror behind the bar. Sid 6.7 has never seen his own image in the real world before. He likes what he sees.

direction.raw_text: Street traffic is much lighter here. Sid 6.7 exits, getting into the vacant police car left by the cops.

direction.raw_text: Sid 6.7 adjusts his seat. The rearview mirror. Glancing at himself. Then behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- IN THE REARVIEW MIRROR Parker becomes visible racing around the corner. Running like a dog who's got the scent.

direction.raw_text: Sid 6.7 looks pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, look who it...

direction.raw_text: ! A bullet spiderwebs the rear window. Sid 6.7 punches the gas, taking off in a hurry.

direction.raw_text: for the innocent MOTORISTS nearby. They SCREAM in absolute terror, but remain unharmed. Physically, anyway. Parker gives up the chase of Sid 6.7's vehicle and runs in the other direction. Toward Madison as she rounds the corner in their squad car.

direction.raw_text: He opens the driver's side door and shoves Madison over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my area of expertise. He jumps behind the wheel, flooring the accelerator. Speeding through the already frightened motorists. Madison is pinned to the back of her seat. Looking out the window, she looks at the motorists.

direction.raw_text: What did you do to those people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parker's vehicle speeds through city streets. Gaining ground on Sid 6.7. Parker stops for nothing. Not for red lights. Not for gridlock. When the street becomes impassable, he veers onto the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parker's eyes are locked to the road with fierce determination. Madison's eyes are a mixture of fear and excitement. She holds onto the door handle for dear life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being on the street's a little different than sitting in an office all day, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enjoying yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't a game, Parker!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad to see you're on the case, Officer Barnes. Or should I say, inmate 673429...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That who I think it is? Parker turns to her, then picks up the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me whatever you want, asshole. Parker accelerates even faster. Closing the gap between them and Sid 6.7.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .7'S VEHICLE Sid 6.7 drives dangerously fast, causing an accident, around which Parker must circumnavigate. Tires SCREECH. Glass
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sid 6.7 hangs his head out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The symphony of collision...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only thing I want to hear is your silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must make them very nervous if they let you out of prison. (a beat) You know, we have so much in common we have such history together I've been thinking we should become friends. Madison's anxiety tanks are hitting capacity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and me have nothing in common.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who else do you know who touches the world with synthetic hands? Parker glances at his mechanical hands gripping the wheel. Madison can't believe he is able to carry on a conversation while driving like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who else do you know who's been locked out of the real world for years, and is now just learning to be free? (a beat) Who else do you know is a multiple murderer just like you? Who else... Madison clicks off the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have nothing in common. She puts her hand to her wrist -- checking her pulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough with your pulse already. (a beat) Still got your gun? Madison takes out her weapon. Her hands are shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me you can use it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid 6.7's vehicle reaches absolute gridlock. Nobody's going anywhere for a while. Sid 6.7 SLAMS on the brakes and abandons the car, leaving it right in the middle of the street. A TRAFFIC COP with his weapon trained on Sid 6.7 from a distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better be a cop, pal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My badge is in my jacket. Left pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me... Sid 6.7 slowly reaches inside his jacket and fires his weapon through it. He only gets a hole in his jacket. The Traffic Cop gets a hole through his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, some people are stupid. He aims his weapon at Parker's oncoming vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison leans out the window, aiming her gun at Sid 6.7, as Parker speeds toward the gridlock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nail the fucker. Madison's determination battles her inexperience. Sid 6.7 gets off the first shot. CRACK! That was the windshield by Parker's head. He ducks down, driving blind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any time now... Madison fires. Nowhere close. She adjusts her sights and fires again. The result is the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doing the best I can!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! That was Sid 6.7 shooting their front left tire. Parker loses control of the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parker's vehicle SLAMS into a car stopped in front of them. Air bags save Parker and Madison from injury, but also prevent them from getting out of the car with any speed. By the time they do get out, Sid 6.7 is long gone. Parker stares at Madison with pure hatred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the L. A. P. D. Downtown Headquarters the next morning. Chief Cox stares angrily at Parker. Madison sits next to him. Behind them is a mirrored wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... illegal search of Lindenmeyer' s duplex. Eleven civilian vehicles damaged or destroyed. Twentyfour citizen complaints. And the calls are just starting to come in... (to Parker) I forgot what it's like to have you on the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any sign of Lindenmeyer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None. He could be hiding, he could be helping Sid, or could be in little pieces on Santa Monica beach. (a beat) Any idea what Sid's going to do next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until we know what new influences are affecting him, we can't be sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In other words, we collectively don't know shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wallace and Deane look on through the twoway mirror. Deane is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes me nervous just seeing him in a uniform. (a beat) I will never forget the first time I saw the photos from the crime scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neither will the public. (a beat) The media has caught wind of his pardon. Unless Mr. Barnes starts giving me some tangible results, I'm going to put him back in his cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The news is in progress. A REPORTER continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police now believe there to be a connection between the grisly Toluca Lake murders yesterday afternoon, and the hostage situation which occurred last night in a downtown bar...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The TV is one of many mounted above the checkout counters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waiting in line with their shopping carts watch the news with varying degrees of horror, disgust, curiosity, and fear. The stronger their reaction, the more Sid 6.7 enjoys it. He is waiting in line holding a box of Twinkies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next. (eyeing the Twinkies) Did you know those aren't even baked? They're chemicallyrisen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So was I. Off the cashier's look, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching the news on a pocket TV on a wooden bench that morning. Both proud and horrified at the monster he has unleashed upon the world. You hear CLASSICAL MUSIC in the background. Lindenmeyer begins to laugh. Uncontrollably. The sounds echoing. As WE PULL BACK, you realize the bench is one of many inside the Hollywood Bowl. Lindenmeyer is the only person sitting in the stands. He glances down at the members of the Los Angeles Philharmonic as they rehearse for an upcoming performance. Whatever the event is, it's going to be big. Dozens of technicians surround the stage, setting lights, cameras, microphones, etc. for a live, payperview broadcast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: talking on a phone inside the Cal Tech Computer Lab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I don't have very good news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the speakerphone inside Cox's Office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you able to get into the program?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. But then I tripped over an erasure mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In English, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I accidently triggered a protection mechanism which erased the entire program. Parker and Madison turn to each other - shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was very wellhidden. There was no way to see it until it was too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not your fault. We appreciate you trying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I feel bad about this, so I'm going to try to look into the programming of his Maestro teaching tool for you. (holding up keyboard) ) I've had one sitting around for years. Maybe I can learn something that you'll find useful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let us know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .7 walking along a sidewalk. Noon. Something in a store front catches his attention. Namely, his own image being captured by a video camera pointed at the sidewalk. He is standing outside a large electronics store. Sid 6.7 walks closer to the window, moving into a CLOSEUP. He is captivated by his image. Fascinated. And intrigued. This is the first time he has ever seen himself on screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dozens of TVs on display. There is a different channel on each. The audio/visual bombardment is overwhelming. Sid 6.7 enters, making his way to a big screen TV with the local news in progress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from the TV) ... commuters travelling anywhere near the Biltmore Hotel downtown tomorrow evening should allow themselves at least 30 extra minutes to get home. Security for the Mayor Bennett's ReElection Rally is going to be so tight that all bus and subway routes passing through the area are being rerouted... Sid 6.7 changes the channel to a different news broadcast. Parker's Folsom County Prison I. D. photograph is shown alongside a photograph of Madison from one of her book covers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you two make a pretty couple. The news broadcast zooms in on Parker's picture. Sid 6.7 wiggles his synthetic fingers in front of his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We really do have so much in common. But I refuse to be upstaged... He changes the channel back to the first news broadcast. A reporter stands amid the chaos outside the bar where Sid 6.7 had terrified the patrons. Sid 6.7 turns to the other CUSTOMERS in the store. Most of them are watching other channels. He goes over to a control pad on a counter and presses several buttons. Now EVERY TV in the store has the news with the reporter outside the bar on. A SKINHEAD, sporting numerous Nazi swastika tattoos, manually changes the channel on one of the TVs to a Dodger baseball game.
